page.title: 04THE ROYAL HOTEL
page.content: The{Royal Hotel}was built in the year 1845.It was opened by Queen Anne later that year.The Hotel is owned by Crest Hotels and it stands on Bath Street.The Royal Hotel was built to house visitors to the Bath Grounds. Here there were large pools for bathing.As there was no springs at Ashby,the water was transported from a natural spring at nearby Moira. The Hotel is unique because all the rooms are different shaped.There are 40 members of staff working there. During the Easter Bank Holiday the Hotel provides accomadation for the carnival guest of honour .The carnival takes place on the Bath Grounds,but first there is a prosession along some of Ashby's streets.Some of the famous people who have attended the carnival are Simon Groome ,Rod Hull and Emu and John Pertwee.
